snippet: When Nicole Gurley took her first dose of heroin, at 15, her mother was already a drug addict. With help, both got sober, and meaningful jobs.
abstract: Community Service Society, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, gives former drug addict Nicole Gurley $250 to pay for her food handler's license and $500 to help pay a student loan.
lead_paragraph: When Nicole Gurley took her first dose of heroin, at 15, her mother was already a drug addict. With help, both got sober, and meaningful jobs.

headline.main: Following Her Mother’s Example, in Addiction and Then in Sobriety
